reviews.review_msg: Thuy is a great prof, lectures were incredibly relevant and interesting. Assignments were fair. Class is easy to do well in if you simply do the work and care about the content.

Thuy is amazing. She cared for my work, especially my writing, and wanted me to succeed as did I. It hurts my heart to see the poor ratings. Students complained about the course being difficult because it is a 200 level course. Readings are long because 1/week course. Expand your knowledge and ways of thinking with this course. Thuy is great.

Fall 2023 3h course: Long weekly/hard to understand readings irrelevant to lecture, no set rubric/grading system, doesn't respond to emails despite encouraging it, instructions inconsistent -- following them is pointless bc she'll dock marks for things she never told you & doesn't give feedback

Oh my goodness I thought that GSWS professors had to go through rigorous training before teaching but it seems like this is not the case for her. She does not know what the lectures are about, the readings are incredibly difficult to digest and have nothing to do with the class material. Never take a class with her.

Everything felt super vague and unclear. The lectures were so long and usually it was completely unnecessary for the class to keep going (nothing important was being said, mostly rambling). The professor is a really sweet human being, but I think even she didn't know what she was talking about most times.

Everything is unclear and vague. English is not her first language I didn't understand a word she said. She's constantly contradicting herself when you ask questions. She doesn't respond to emails. No rubric no instructions. 30-page readings. hard marking because she contradicts herself and if you do what she says then marks you wrong for it.

took this as a 3h course in Fall 2023 | +ve: easy to connect w | -ve: pre-class readings are boring and incomprehensible even after lectures; tends to drone on bc English is not her first language; INCONSISTENT INSTRUCTIONS in class vs Canvas (no rubrics); sometimes does not respond to emails when you ask her a question; painfully vague feedback
